at.ac.tuwien.infosys.g2021.common.communication

Interface ClientRequestExecutionStrategy


  • public interface ClientRequestExecutionStrategy
    This interface defines all the necessary methods to handle incoming requests from the clients and their GBots in the daemon.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      BufferConfiguration bufferConfiguration(DaemonEndpoint conn, java.lang.String bufferName)
      Returns the configuration of a buffer.

      Returns the value of a buffer.

      This method must handle a communication error at the client connection.

      This method looks for available buffers.

      This method looks for available buffers.

    • Method Detail

      • connectionDied

        void connectionDied(DaemonEndpoint conn)
        This method must handle a communication error at the client connection.
        Parameters:
        conn - the connection

      • shutdown

        void shutdown(DaemonEndpoint conn)
        A shutdown request has been received.
        Parameters:
        conn - the connection

      • bufferExists

        boolean bufferExists(DaemonEndpoint conn,
                     java.lang.String bufferName)
        Exists a buffer with a given name?
        Parameters:
        conn - the connection
        bufferName - the name of the buffer
        Returns:
        true, if a buffer with this name is known

      • queryBuffersByName

        java.util.Set<java.lang.String> queryBuffersByName(DaemonEndpoint conn,
                                                   java.lang.String name)
        This method looks for available buffers.
        Parameters:
        conn - the connection
        name - a regular expression specifying the buffer name, which should be scanned. A simple match satisfy the search condition, the regular expression must not match the whole name.
        Returns:
        a collection of all the buffers matching this query

      • queryBuffersByMetainfo

        java.util.Set<java.lang.String> queryBuffersByMetainfo(DaemonEndpoint conn,
                                                       java.lang.String topic,
                                                       java.lang.String feature)
        This method looks for available buffers.
        Parameters:
        conn - the connection
        topic - a regular expression specifying the buffer topics, which should be scanned for the wanted features. These are keys of the buffer meta information. A simple match satisfy the search condition, the regular expression must not match the whole topic name.
        feature - a regular expression specifying the buffer features, which should be scanned. A simple match satisfy the search condition, the regular expression must not match the whole feature description.
        Returns:
        a collection of all the buffers matching this query

      • bufferConfiguration

        BufferConfiguration bufferConfiguration(DaemonEndpoint conn,
                                        java.lang.String bufferName)
        Returns the configuration of a buffer.
        Parameters:
        conn - the connection
        bufferName - the name of the buffer
        Returns:
        the buffer configuration or null, is no buffer with this name is known

      • setBufferConfiguration

        boolean setBufferConfiguration(DaemonEndpoint conn,
                               java.lang.String bufferName,
                               BufferConfiguration config,
                               boolean create)
        Changes the configuration of a buffer. If the buffer doesn't exists and the create-argument is set to true, a new buffer is created.
        Parameters:
        conn - the connection
        bufferName - the name of the buffer
        Returns:
        the buffer configuration or null, is no buffer with this name is known

      • bufferValue

        SimpleData bufferValue(DaemonEndpoint conn,
                       java.lang.String bufferName)
        Returns the value of a buffer.
        Parameters:
        conn - the connection
        bufferName - the name of the buffer
        Returns:
        the current value or null, is no buffer with this name is known

      • setBufferValue

        SimpleData setBufferValue(DaemonEndpoint conn,
                          java.lang.String bufferName,
                          double value)
        Sets the value of a buffer.
        Parameters:
        conn - the connection
        bufferName - the name of the buffer
        value - the new buffer value
        Returns:
        the new current value of the buffer or null, is no buffer with this name is known

      • releaseBuffer

        boolean releaseBuffer(DaemonEndpoint conn,
                      java.lang.String bufferName)
        Releases a buffer.
        Parameters:
        conn - the connection
        bufferName - the name of the buffer
        Returns:
        true, if the buffer is now released
